title: Honduras says plans to open diplomatic relations with China
description: Diplomatic ties with Taiwan have become a flashpoint in Central America, where Beijing is looking to deepen links.

title: Inflation in Argentina surges past 100 percent in historic spike
description: The country's inflation has not surpassed 100 percent in over three decades, as value of Argentina's currency plummets.

title: Will peace ever come to eastern Democratic Republic of the Congo?
description: Fighting in eastern Democratic Republic of the Congo has worsened in recent months.

title: FIFA confirms expanded 2026 World Cup with record 104 matches
description: Format for event in US, Canada and Mexico will stick to four teams per group as plan for 16 groups of three shot down.

title: Ex-Pakistan PM Imran Khan says arrest attempt ‘totally illegal’
description: Khan tells Al Jazeera an arrest warrant is a politically motivated attempt to 'remove him' from upcoming elections.

title: White House slams Russian collision with US drone over Black Sea
description: Washington says 'reckless' Russian jet manoeuvres forced US to bring down drone, but Moscow denies collision occurred.

title: US Republican DeSantis calls Ukraine war a ‘territorial dispute’
description: Florida governor and other leading conservative US presidential hopefuls express scepticism of Washington's aid to Kyiv.

title: US agency takes aim at ‘forever chemicals’ in drinking water
description: Environmental Protection Agency proposes first federal limits on 'forever chemicals', saying the move will save lives.

title: Biden issues new order in effort to curb US gun violence
description: Executive order aiming to expand firearm background checks signed amid ongoing challenge of passing US gun control laws.

title: Silicon Valley Bank execs, parent company sued after collapse
description: Class-action lawsuit seeking damages alleges that tech-focused bank failed to disclose risks from interest rate hikes.

title: Muslim TikTok comedian ‘attacked’ over Jeffrey Marsh criticism
description: Shumirun Nessa says she has faced a backlash that has spilled into the real world after posting about the US activist.

title: Facebook owner Meta to cut 10,000 jobs in second round of layoffs
description: Meta is slashing jobs in a bid to recover from losses and invest in the 'metaverse'.

title: Has Yemen’s government been sidelined after Saudi-Iran deal?
description: Saudi-Iran normalisation deal leads to hope for end to the war in Yemen, but will forces in the country have their say?

title: Armenian PM critical of Russia-dominated security pact
description: Nikol Pashinyan notes 'objective problems' in relations with Kremlin, but says they have not grown into a crisis.

title: Elderly Swiss women take government to court over climate
description: European Court of Human Rights to hear case brought by women aged about 70 who say officials must do more.

title: Tear gas fired outside ex-Pakistan PM Imran Khan’s residence
description: Police action comes day after Islamabad court issued arrest warrants for Imran Khan in corruption and 'terrorism' cases.

title: Two Pakistani policemen killed in attacks on census teams
description: No claim of responsibility for Khyber Pakhtunkhwa attacks which took place as country carries out its seventh census.

title: Canada: Two dead, 9 injured after truck ploughs into pedestrians
description: Quebec's Deputy Premier Geneviève Guilbault said it was too early to say if the driver intentionally hit the people.

title: The UN’s climate handbook for a ‘liveable’ future
description: Hitting the 2015 Paris temperature goals will require a massive reduction in fossil fuel use, IPCC reports say.

title: Lebanon’s currency value plunges to 100,000 against US dollar
description: The value of the Lebanese pound on the parallel market is at a historic low as the country's economic crisis continues.

title: Lahore most polluted city, Pakistan third among countries: Survey
description: IQAir report says India and Pakistan experienced the worst air quality in the Central and South Asian regions in 2022.

title: Analysis: Iran eases its regional isolation with Saudi deal
description: Iran and Saudi Arabia agreed to restore diplomatic relations, but Tehran is likely to keep its foreign policy pillars.

title: Israel was built on burned Palestinian villages
description: What happened in Huwara was neither new nor out of the ordinary.

title: Nigeria’s central bank says old naira notes still legal tender
description: Cash shortages have plagued Africa's largest economy since the beginning of the year, due to a CBN directive.

title: Controversial Willow oil project in Alaska: Here’s what to know
description: US government decision to greenlight ConocoPhillips Alaska’s $8bn Willow oil project received praise and condemnation.

title: Why I’m striking: A nurse on the picket lines in the UK
description: A nurse reflects on what it means to be overworked and underpaid in a profession that provides life-saving care.

title: Will a new cricket league be able to break through in the US?
description: MLC, the latest on the list of cricket leagues around the world, is set to take place in the US in July.

title: Controversial judicial law passes first vote in Israeli Knesset
description: Bill that weakens Supreme Court passes first reading, alongside a bill that would protect PM from removal.

title: Dick Fosbury, high jump pioneer, dies aged 76
description: Forbury, who won Olympic gold in 1968, revolutionised the event with a radically different jumping technique.

title: Taliban launches annual polio vaccination drive in Afghanistan
description: Health ministry says four-day campaign will cover more than nine million children in 31 of the country's 34 provinces.

title: South African court orders healthcare workers to end strike
description: Government officials say the strike adversely affected clinical operations across the country's big hospitals.

title: Philippine police officer jailed for killing teens in ‘drug war’
description: Ex-officer found guilty of murdering two teenagers aged 14 and 19, and was sentenced to 20 years in prison.

title: China to resume issuing all visa types for first time since 2020
description: China says it will start issuing all categories of visas to foreigners from Wednesday, March 15, 2023.

title: Cyclone Freddy death toll in Malawi, Mozambique passes 100
description: Malawians dig through mud for survivors; Mozambique says fallout from storm's second landfall was worse than expected.

title: Photos: Hong Kong’s ‘villain hitting’ ritual draws crowds
description: Clients bash an image of their target with a shoe in an effort to relieve themselves of bad moods.

title: Why Indonesia is losing the West Papua conflict
description: The country's government has focused on containing, rather than resolving, a crisis with roots in a dubious referendum.

title: Future of Ukraine depends on eastern battlefields: Zelenskyy
description: Ukraine’s President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that Russian forces must be stopped in Bakhmut and other towns in the east.

title: What is Pi Day? The story of the circle
description: Celebrated every March 14, Pi Day aims to raise awareness about the role of mathematics and how it shapes our world.

title: Police use of rubber bullets maiming thousands globally: Amnesty
description: Rights group says a global Torture-Free Trade treaty is urgently needed to regulate the trade in policing equipment.

title: Taiwan says it hopes to bring back soldier who went to China

title: Russia, China creating world of ‘danger, disorder, division’: UK

title: Why Chinese students are an increasingly rare sight in Taiwan
description: Caught in the middle of rising cross-strait tensions, there are few Chinese students left on the self-ruled island.

title: Will the missing Malaysian airliner MH370 ever be found?
description: Nine years on and still no clear answers in one of the world’s biggest aviation mysteries.

title: North Korea fires two missiles, second test in three days
description: Launches come as the US and S Korea carry out large-scale military exercises N Korea sees as rehearsals for invasion.

title: Why Australia wants nuclear-powered submarines
description: Acquiring nuclear-powered submarines described as 'the single biggest leap' ever in Australia's defence capabilities.

title: US extends humanitarian status for Ukrainians who fled war
description: The decision allows Ukrainians living in the US to continue accessing services and allays concerns over legal limbo.
